1.verse: From Paul, an apostle—not from men, nor through man, but through Jesus Christ and God the Father who raised him from the dead—

2.verse: and all the brothers who are with me, to the churches of Galatia:

3.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ,

4.verse: who gave himself for our sins in order to rescue us from this present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father,

5.verse: to whom be glory for all time! Amen.

6.verse: I am astonished that you are so quickly deserting the one who called you by the grace of Christ and are turning to a different gospel—

7.verse: not that there is another gospel, but there are some who are trying to confuse you and want to pervert the gospel of Christ.

8.verse: But even if we, or an angel from heaven, should preach a gospel at odds with the one we already preached to you, let him be accursed.

9.verse: As we have said before, and now I say again: If anyone is preaching to you a gospel at odds with the one you have already received, let him be accursed.

10.verse: For am I now seeking the approval of men, or of God? Or am I trying to please men? If I were still trying to please men, I would not be a servant of Christ.

11.verse: I want you to know, brothers, that the gospel preached by me is not of human origin.

12.verse: For I did not receive it from man, nor was I taught it; instead I received it by a revelation from Jesus Christ.

13.verse: For you have heard of my former way of life in Judaism, how intensely I used to persecute the church of God and was trying to destroy it.

14.verse: And I was advancing in Judaism beyond many of my own age in the entire nation, being extremely zealous for the traditions of my ancestors.

15.verse: But when God, who had set me apart from my mother’s womb and called me by his grace, was pleased

16.verse: to reveal his Son in me so that I might preach him among the Gentiles, I did not consult with flesh and blood,

17.verse: nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me; but I went away into Arabia and returned again to Damascus.

18.verse: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to get acquainted with Cephas and stayed with him fifteen days.

19.verse: But I did not see any of the other apostles—except James, the Lord’s brother.

20.verse: In what I am writing to you, I swear before God, I am not lying!

21.verse: After that I went to the regions of Syria and Cilicia.

22.verse: But I was still personally unknown to the churches of Judea that are in Christ.

23.verse: They only kept hearing, “The one who formerly persecuted us is now preaching the faith that he once tried to destroy.”

24.verse: So they praised God because of me.

1.verse: Then after fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus along as well.

2.verse: I went up in response to a revelation and laid out before them—though privately before the acknowledged leaders—the gospel that I proclaim among the Gentiles, lest somehow I was running, or had run, in vain.

3.verse: Yet not even Titus, who was with me, was compelled to be circumcised, though he was a Greek.

4.verse: This matter came up because of some false brothers secretly brought in—they had slipped in to spy out our freedom that we have in Christ Jesus so that they might make slaves of us—

5.verse: but to them we did not yield in submission even for a moment, so that the truth of the gospel would be preserved for you.

6.verse: But from those who were supposed to be acknowledged leaders (what they were makes no difference to me; God shows no partiality)—those leaders contributed nothing to me.

7.verse: But on the contrary, when they saw that I had been entrusted with the gospel for the uncircumcised just as Peter had been entrusted with the gospel for the circumcised

8.verse: (for the one who empowered Peter for his apostleship to the circumcised also empowered me for mine to the Gentiles)

9.verse: and when James and Cephas and John, who were acknowledged pillars, recognized the grace that had been given to me, they gave to Barnabas and me the right hand of fellowship, agreeing that we should go to the Gentiles and they to the circumcised.

10.verse: They asked only that we should continue to remember the poor, the very thing I too was eager to do.

11.verse: But when Cephas came to Antioch, I opposed him to his face, because he stood condemned.

12.verse: For until certain men came from James, he used to eat with the Gentiles; but when they arrived, he began to draw back and separate himself because he feared those of the circumcision party.

13.verse: And the rest of the Jews joined him in playing the hypocrite, so that even Barnabas was led astray by their hypocrisy.

14.verse: But when I saw that they were not behaving in a manner consistent with the truth of the gospel, I said to Cephas before them all, “If you, born a Jew, live like a Gentile and not like a Jew, by what right are you trying to make the Gentiles live like Jews?”

15.verse: We ourselves are Jews by birth and not Gentile sinners;

16.verse: yet we know that no one is justified by the works of the law but through faith in Jesus Christ. And we have come to believe in Christ Jesus, so that we might be justified by faith in Christ, and not by doing the works of the law, since no one will be justified by the works of the law.

17.verse: But if, while seeking to be justified in Christ, we ourselves have also been found to be sinners, is Christ then a servant of sin? Of course not!

18.verse: But if I build up again those things I once tore down, then I demonstrate that I am a lawbreaker.

19.verse: For through the law I died to the law so that I might live for God. I have been crucified with Christ;

20.verse: and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. And the life I now live in the flesh, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.

21.verse: I do not nullify the grace of God; for if righteousness could be gained through the law, then Christ died for nothing!

1.verse: O foolish Galatians! Who has bewitched you, before whose eyes Jesus Christ was publicly exhibited as crucified?

2.verse: Only this I want to learn from you: Did you receive the Spirit by works of the law or by hearing with faith?

3.verse: Are you so foolish? Having begun by the Spirit, would you now attain your goal by the flesh?

4.verse: Have you suffered so many things for no purpose?—if it really was for no purpose.

5.verse: So does the one who gives you the Spirit and works miracles among you do it by works of the law, or by hearing with faith?

6.verse: Consider Abraham: “He believed God, and it was reckoned to him as righteousness.”

7.verse: Know then that it is those of faith who are the sons of Abraham.

8.verse: And the Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith, preached the gospel beforehand to Abraham, saying, “In you will all nations be blessed.”

9.verse: So then, those who believe are blessed along with Abraham, the believer.

10.verse: For all who rely on works of the law are under a curse; for it is written, “Cursed is everyone who does not continue in all things written in the book of the law, to do them.”

11.verse: Now it is clear that no one is justified before God by the law, because “it is by faith that the righteous person will live.”

12.verse: However, the law is not of faith; on the contrary, it teaches that “the one who does them will live by them.”

13.verse: Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law by becoming a curse for us—for it is written, “Cursed is everyone who is hung on a tree”—

14.verse: in order that in Christ Jesus the blessing of Abraham might come to the Gentiles, so that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.

15.verse: To speak in human terms, brothers: even though a covenant is one made by man, yet when it has been ratified, no one can set it aside or add anything to it.

16.verse: Now the promises were made to Abraham and to his descendant. Scripture does not say, “and to descendants,” referring to many, but “and to your descendant,” referring to one, who is Christ.

17.verse: What I am saying is this: the law, which came four hundred and thirty years later, does not annul a covenant previously established by God, so as to make the promise void.

18.verse: For if the inheritance is based on law, it is no longer based on a promise; but God gave it to Abraham through a promise.

19.verse: Why then was the law given? It was added because of transgressions, until the descendant should come to whom the promise had been made. It was established through angels by a mediator.

20.verse: Now a mediator is not for one party only, but God is one.

21.verse: Is the law, therefore, opposed to the promises of God? Certainly not! For if a law had been given that could impart life, then righteousness would indeed be by the law.

22.verse: But the Scripture confined everything under sin, so that what was promised through faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe.

23.verse: Now before faith came, we were held in custody under the law, imprisoned until the coming faith would be revealed.

24.verse: Thus the law was our disciplinarian until the time of Christ, so that we might be declared righteous by faith.

25.verse: But now that faith has come, we are no longer under a guardian.

26.verse: For you are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus.

27.verse: For as many of you as were baptized into Christ have clothed yourselves with Christ.

28.verse: Now there is neither Jew nor Greek, neither slave nor free, neither male nor female; for you are all one in Christ Jesus.

29.verse: And if you belong to Christ, then you are descendants of Abraham, heirs according to the promise.

1.verse: What I am saying is that as long as the heir is a minor, he differs not at all from a slave, even though in fact he owns the entire estate.

2.verse: However, he remains under the care of guardians and managers until the time determined by his father.

3.verse: And so it is with us. While we were minors, we were enslaved to the elementary principles of the world.

4.verse: But when the fullness of time had come, God sent forth his Son, born of a woman, born under law,

5.verse: to redeem those who were under law, so that we might receive adoption as sons.

6.verse: And because you are sons, God sent the Spirit of his Son into our hearts, who cries out “Abba! Father!”

7.verse: So you are no longer a slave, but a son; and since you are a son, then you are an heir through God.

8.verse: Formerly, when you did not know God, you were enslaved to those who by nature are not gods.

9.verse: But now that you have come to know God—or rather, are known by God—how can you turn back again to the feeble and inferior elementary principles of the world? How can you want to be their slaves all over again?

10.verse: You scrupulously observe special days and months and seasons and years!

11.verse: I am afraid that I may have labored over you to no avail.

12.verse: Become as I am, because I have become as you are; I plead with you, brothers. You have done me no wrong.

13.verse: You know that it was due to a physical infirmity that I preached the gospel to you at first;

14.verse: and though my condition was a trial to you, you did not despise or reject me, but you welcomed me as an angel of God, as though I were Christ Jesus.

15.verse: What then became of the blessing you enjoyed? For I testify about you that, if possible, you would have torn out your eyes and given them to me!

16.verse: So then, have I become your enemy by telling you the truth?

17.verse: They zealously seek your favor, but for no good purpose. Rather, they want to separate you from us so that you will seek them.

18.verse: Now to be zealous for a good purpose is always good, not just when I am present with you.

19.verse: My little children, for whom I am again in the pain of childbirth until Christ is formed in you,

20.verse: I wish I could be with you now and change my tone, for I am perplexed about you.

21.verse: Tell me, you who want to be under the law, will you not listen to the law?

22.verse: For it is written that Abraham had two sons, one by the slave woman and one by the free woman.

23.verse: The son by the slave woman was born according to the flesh, but the son by the free woman was born as the result of promise.

24.verse: This may be interpreted allegorically, for these women represent two covenants. One is from Mount Sinai, bearing children to be slaves; she is Hagar.

25.verse: Now Hagar represents Mount Sinai in Arabia and corresponds to the present Jerusalem, for she is in slavery with her children.

26.verse: But the Jerusalem above is the free woman, and she is our mother.

27.verse: For it is written, “Rejoice, O barren woman, you who bear no children; break forth and cry aloud, you who are not in the pain of childbirth! For the children of the desolate will be more in number than those of the woman who has a husband.

28.verse: But you, my brothers, like Isaac, are children of promise.

29.verse: But just as at that time the one who was born according to the flesh persecuted the one who was born according to the Spirit, so also it is now.

30.verse: But what does the Scripture say? “Drive away the slave woman and her son, for the son of the slave woman must not share the inheritance with the son of the free woman.”

31.verse: So then, brothers, we are not children of a slave woman but of the free woman.

1.verse: For freedom Christ has set us free. Stand firm, therefore, and do not be subject again to a yoke of slavery.

2.verse: Listen! I, Paul, tell you that if you agree to circumcision, Christ will be of no benefit to you.

3.verse: And furthermore I declare to every man who agrees to circumcision that he is obligated to obey the entire law.

4.verse: You have cut yourself off from Christ, you who are trying to be justified by the law; you have fallen away from grace.

5.verse: For we by the Spirit, through faith, eagerly await the righteousness for which we hope.

6.verse: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision counts for anything, but only faith expressing itself through love.

7.verse: You were running well; who hindered you from obeying the truth?

8.verse: Such persuasion does not come from the one who calls you.

9.verse: A little leaven leavens the whole lump of dough!

10.verse: I am confident about you in the Lord that you will not think otherwise. But the one who is trying to confuse you will pay the penalty, whoever he may be.

11.verse: But I, brothers, if I am still preaching circumcision, why am I still being persecuted? In that case the offense of the cross has been removed.

12.verse: I wish those who are disturbing you would mutilate themselves!

13.verse: For you, brothers, were called to freedom. Only do not use your freedom as an opportunity for the flesh, but through love serve one another.

14.verse: For the entire law is summed up in a single command: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”

15.verse: But if you keep on biting and devouring one another, watch out that you are not consumed by one another.

16.verse: So I say, live by the Spirit and you will not gratify the desires of the flesh.

17.verse: For the desires of the flesh are against the Spirit, and the desires of the Spirit are against the flesh; for these are opposed to one another, to keep you from doing the things you want to do.

18.verse: But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law.

19.verse: Now the works of the flesh are obvious: sexual immorality, impurity, debauchery,

20.verse: idolatry, sorcery, quarrels, strife, jealousy, fits of rage, selfish rivalries, dissensions, divisions,

21.verse: envyings, drunkenness, orgies, and things like these. I warn you, as I warned you before: those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God!

22.verse: By contrast, the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, generosity, faithfulness,

23.verse: gentleness, self-control; against such things there is no law.

24.verse: And those who belong to Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires.

25.verse: Since we live by the Spirit, let us also be guided by the Spirit.

26.verse: Let us not become conceited, provoking one another, being jealous of one another.

1.verse: My brothers, if someone is detected in some wrongdoing, you who are spiritual should restore that one in a spirit of gentleness, taking care lest you yourself be tempted.

2.verse: Bear one another’s burdens, and in this way you will fulfill the law of Christ.

3.verse: For if anyone thinks he is something, when he is nothing, he deceives himself.

4.verse: But let each one examine his own work, and then he will have reason for boasting in himself alone, and not in comparison with someone else.

5.verse: For each one will bear his own load.

6.verse: Now the one who is taught the word must share all good things with the one who teaches.

7.verse: Do not be deceived: God is not mocked. For whatever a person sows, that will he also reap.

8.verse: For the one who sows to his own flesh, from the flesh will reap corruption; but the one who sows to the Spirit, from the Spirit will reap eternal life.

9.verse: So let us not grow tired of doing what is right, for in due time we will reap, if we do not give up.

10.verse: So then, as we have opportunity, let us do good to everyone, and especially to those of the family of faith.

11.verse: See with what large letters I am writing to you with my own hand!

12.verse: Those who want to make a good showing in the flesh, they are the ones trying to force you to be circumcised—only so that they may not be persecuted for the cross of Christ.

13.verse: For even those who are circumcised do not themselves keep the law, but they want you to be circumcised so that they may boast in your flesh.

14.verse: But may I never boast, except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world.

15.verse: For neither circumcision nor uncircumcision is anything, but a new creation.

16.verse: As for all who will follow this rule—may peace and mercy be upon them, even upon the Israel of God.

17.verse: From now on let no one cause me trouble, for I bear the marks of Jesus on my body.

18.verse: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, my brothers. Amen.
